info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 12 at 6:14PM EDT until September 12 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN MECKLENBURG COUNTY... At 614 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported widespread flooding across the warned area due to heavy rain from thunderstorms. In addition, debris is being washed on to portions of Route 1 south of the US 58 intersection. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... South Hill, Brodnax, La Crosse, Beechwood, Bracey, Palmer Springs, John H Kerr Dam, Keats, Forksville and Eppes Fork. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
